references.paper_title: 3d gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper is foundational as the original 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) paper, a technique which the current paper extends into the temporal domain for 4D CT reconstruction.

references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduced Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), a novel method for representing complex 3D scenes which has led to improved methods for CT reconstruction.

references.paper_title: Intratomo: Self-supervised learning-based tomography via sinogram synthesis and prediction
references.reason: This paper presents a NeRF-based method called IntraTomo for CT reconstruction using self-supervised learning, which is relevant because the current paper also utilizes self-supervision.

references.paper_title: Radiative gaussian splatting for efficient x-ray novel view synthesis
references.reason: This paper presents X-GS, the first 3DGS-based method designed for X-ray projection rendering, which is a direct precursor to the proposed X2-Gaussian method.

references.paper_title: R2-gaussian: Rectifying radiative gaussian splatting for tomographic reconstruction
references.reason: This paper presents R2-GS, a work which rectifies the 3DGS pipeline to enable the direct CT reconstruction, serving as a baseline comparison for the dynamic reconstruction in the current paper.
